original: rlung dang bad kan dang mkhris pa la sogs pa so so rang rang gi nad dmigs skyes pa dang / nad de byang ste zad par gyur pa sman pas shes par gyis shig / de yang mi'i lus la rlung nad lta bu grang zhing rtsub pa med de bde ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa 'dug pa las /
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan dang mkhris pa la sogs pa so so rang rang gi nad dmigs skyes pa dang / nad de byang ste zad par gyur pa sman pas shes par gyis shig / de yang mi'i lus la rlung nad lta bu grang zhing rtsub pa med de bde ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa 'dug pa las /
translated: in the human body, for example, there is no cold or rough wind disease, but there is a pleasant quality.

original: rlung nad du gyur te khong grang zhing rtsub pas na ba med pa'i yon tan de nyams shing zad pa'i tshe na rlung nang skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung nad du gyur te khong grang zhing rtsub pas na ba med pa'i yon tan de nyams shing zad pa'i tshe na rlung nang skyes pa yin no //
translated: When the good quality of being free from illness is lost and exhausted because of an internal wind disorder that is cold and rough, then it is called ‚Äúan internal wind disorder.‚Äù

original: rlung nad khong grangs zhing rtsub pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rlung nad khong grangs zhing rtsub pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúa cold and rough internal wind disorder.‚Äù

original: khong pa drod 'babs la /
analyzed: khong pa drod 'babs la /
translated: The stomach loses heat.

original: lus kyi khong 'jam zhing snum par gyur pa na bde ba'i yon tan skyes pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'di gnyis kyi tshul phan @394a * //
analyzed: lus kyi khong 'jam zhing snum par gyur pa na bde ba'i yon tan skyes pa zhes bya ba ste / 'di gnyis kyi tshul phan @394a * //
translated: When the inside of the body becomes smooth and oily, it is called ‚Äúthe good quality of comfort arising.‚Äù

original: tshun du bzlog ste ba lta'o //
analyzed: tshun du bzlog ste ba lta'o //
translated: The ways of these two are reversed in relation to each other.

original: yang lus kyi dri ma thur du 'byung ba bshang gci gnyis ran par 'ong ba ni lus la phan no //
analyzed: yang lus kyi dri ma thur du 'byung ba bshang gci gnyis ran par 'ong ba ni lus la phan no //
translated: Also, the body‚Äôs impurities that flow downward‚Äîthe feces and urine‚Äîcome out in moderation, which is beneficial for the body.

original: bshang gci gnyis ha cang brtsal ba drags te dper na sman gyis bkrus sam /
analyzed: bshang gci gnyis ha cang brtsal ba drags te dper na sman gyis bkrus sam /
translated: If the feces and urine are expelled with too much effort, for example, as if one were washing with medicine,

original: tshad pas drag tu 'khru ste nang gi dri ma zad cing stong par gyur na /
analyzed: tshad pas drag tu 'khru ste nang gi dri ma zad cing stong par gyur na /
translated: or if one has a strong diarrhea due to a fever, and the internal impurities are exhausted and the body becomes empty,

original: lus kyi nyams mthu zad de gnod /
analyzed: lus kyi nyams mthu zad de gnod /
translated: the body‚Äôs strength is exhausted and one is harmed.

original: lus 'di ni dri ma bshang gcis khor brtan te 'dug pa yin /
analyzed: lus 'di ni dri ma bshang gcis khor brtan te 'dug pa yin /
translated: This body is filled with the impurities of feces and urine and remains that way.

original: lus de'i khong pa nang dri ma rnams kyis brtan te 'dug pa de la /
analyzed: lus de'i khong pa nang dri ma rnams kyis brtan te 'dug pa de la /
translated: The impurities of the body are held within it.

original: dri ma kun phyir phyung ste stong par zad par byas na gnod do //
analyzed: dri ma kun phyir phyung ste stong par zad par byas na gnod do //
translated: If all the impurities are expelled and the body is emptied, it is harmed.

original: de'i phyir dri ma khong brtan zhing 'dug ba gnod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dri ma khong brtan zhing 'dug ba gnod ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the impurities held within it harm it.

original: yang rus pa la rlung gnas shing zhen pa lta bu la rus pa la phan pa'i sman byas na /
analyzed: yang rus pa la rlung gnas shing zhen pa lta bu la rus pa la phan pa'i sman byas na /
translated: Also, the wind abides and clings to the bones. If a medicine that is good for the bones is taken,

original: rus pa la yang phan la rlung nad kyang zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rus pa la yang phan la rlung nad kyang zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it will benefit the bones and pacify the wind illness.

original: rus pa la gnod pa'i sman zos na yang rlung de bzhin skye'o //
analyzed: rus pa la gnod pa'i sman zos na yang rlung de bzhin skye'o //
translated: If a medicine that is bad for the bones is taken, the wind will arise in the same way.

original: yang na mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang rdul gsum tshul gcig ste /
analyzed: yang na mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang rdul gsum tshul gcig ste /
translated: Also, the three‚Äîbile, phlegm, and pus‚Äîare the same.

analyzed: mkhris pa skye ba'i sman byas na khrag nang zhi ba'am / khrag nad skye ba'am / rdul byung ba'am /

original: rdul zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a medicine that produces pus is taken, it will produce blood disorders.üîΩIf a medicine that pacifies pus is taken, it will pacify bile disorders.

original: de bzhin du bad kan byang ba'i sman btang na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan byang ba'i sman btang na /
translated: Similarly, if a medicine that purges phlegm is taken,

original: bcud dangs ma dang / tshil dang / sha dang / rkang dang / khu ba rnams kyang stongs te zad par byed /
analyzed: bcud dangs ma dang / tshil dang / sha dang / rkang dang / khu ba rnams kyang stongs te zad par byed /
translated: The vital essence, fat, flesh, marrow, and fluids are also depleted and exhausted.

original: bad kan skye bar 'gyur ba'i sman dang kha zas zos na khams 'di lnga yang skye zhing brta'o //
analyzed: bad kan skye bar 'gyur ba'i sman dang kha zas zos na khams 'di lnga yang skye zhing brta'o //
translated: When one eats food and drink that generates phlegm, these five elements grow and flourish.

original: de bas na rus pa dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang khrag dang bad kan dang bcud sha chil 'di rnams kun phan tshun gcig la gcig brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rus pa dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang khrag dang bad kan dang bcud sha chil 'di rnams kun phan tshun gcig la gcig brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these bones, wind, bile, blood, phlegm, and vital essence, flesh, and fat all mutually support each other.

original: de lta bas na 'di gsum gang yang rung ba gcig la phan pa'i zas dang / sman btang na de la brten nas gzhan la yang phan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di gsum gang yang rung ba gcig la phan pa'i zas dang / sman btang na de la brten nas gzhan la yang phan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if one takes food and medicine that is beneficial for any one of these three, on the basis of that, the others will also be helped.

original: gcig la gnod pa'i zas dang sman btang na /
analyzed: gcig la gnod pa'i zas dang sman btang na /
translated: If one takes food and medicine that is harmful to one,üîΩon the basis of that, the others will also be harmed.

original: de la brten pa rnams la yang gnod par 'gyur ba yin yang de la rlung rus pa la gnas shing brten pa lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: de la brten pa rnams la yang gnod par 'gyur ba yin yang de la rlung rus pa la gnas shing brten pa lta bur gyur te /
translated: The wind is like a bone that is the support and basis for that.

original: de'i dpyad rlung skye bar 'gyur ba'i rtsi sman btang na /
analyzed: de'i dpyad rlung skye bar 'gyur ba'i rtsi sman btang na /
translated: If one takes medicine and herbs that generate wind,

original: rus pa la gnod kyi de lta bu ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rus pa la gnod kyi de lta bu ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not right to harm the bones.

original: lus la phan pa'i bad kan dang 'phrod pa kha zas snum zhing bsod pa'i sman byin na /
analyzed: lus la phan pa'i bad kan dang 'phrod pa kha zas snum zhing bsod pa'i sman byin na /
translated: If one gives food that is nourishing and beneficial to the body, such as unctuous and nutritious medicine,

original: de lta bu ni phal cher lus brtan te lus la phan no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni phal cher lus brtan te lus la phan no //
translated: the body will mostly be stable and benefit from it.

original: de la yang zas kyi cho ga bzlog ste rlung skye bar @394b 'gyur ba'i kha zas grang zhing rtsub pa lta bu zos na /
analyzed: de la yang zas kyi cho ga bzlog ste rlung skye bar @394b 'gyur ba'i kha zas grang zhing rtsub pa lta bu zos na /
translated: If one reverses the rules of diet and eats food that is cold and rough, which gives rise to wind,

original: rlung skye ba la khong 'jam zhing snum bag zad pas lus la gnod cing nyam par byed de /
analyzed: rlung skye ba la khong 'jam zhing snum bag zad pas lus la gnod cing nyam par byed de /
translated: the wind will arise, and the body will be harmed and weakened by the smooth and oily food.

original: de bas na gcig la gnod la phan par 'gyur ba'i dpyad de lta bu ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na gcig la gnod la phan par 'gyur ba'i dpyad de lta bu ni mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, such a treatment that harms one thing and benefits another is not right.

original: nad gnyis kar mi 'gyur ba'i sman dpyad bya'o //
analyzed: nad gnyis kar mi 'gyur ba'i sman dpyad bya'o //
translated: One should prescribe a treatment that is medicine for both diseases.

original: de la lus ha cang brtas shing bde ba las drags te /
analyzed: de la lus ha cang brtas shing bde ba las drags te /
translated: In that case, if the body is too strong and comfortable,

original: bad kan nam ma zhu ba la sogs par gyur pa lta bu la zas 'bri zhing 'ju sman gyis nad bsal du rung bar smin par bya ba dang / lus la nad kyis nyams smad de nyams 'tshag zad pa lta bu la brta par bya ste /
analyzed: bad kan nam ma zhu ba la sogs par gyur pa lta bu la zas 'bri zhing 'ju sman gyis nad bsal du rung bar smin par bya ba dang / lus la nad kyis nyams smad de nyams 'tshag zad pa lta bu la brta par bya ste /
translated: When the body is weak from illness, as if exhausted and emaciated, one should be careful.

original: nad rnam pa 'di gnyis lta bur gyur pa la /
analyzed: nad rnam pa 'di gnyis lta bur gyur pa la /
translated: For these two types of illness,

original: thabs 'di 'dra ba 'di'i dpyad myur du bya'o //
analyzed: thabs 'di 'dra ba 'di'i dpyad myur du bya'o //
translated: one should quickly examine and apply this kind of method.

original: de la rlung nad kyi bag yod pa lta bu la ni zas smyung zhing dbri ba'am /
analyzed: de la rlung nad kyi bag yod pa lta bu la ni zas smyung zhing dbri ba'am /
translated: For example, in the case of a wind illness, fasting or reducing food

analyzed: smyung bar bya ba 'di mi rung ste ma gtogs so // 'di lta bu'i bag ma yin pa gzhi mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i nad kyi tshul ci 'dra ba las /
translated: is not suitable and should be avoided.üîΩIn this way, for the basis of a wind illness, one should apply the method of transforming and reversing the way bile, phlegm, and wind illnesses arise.

original: de'i dpyad bsgyur zhing bzlog thabs kyi bya bar sbyor cig / yang dmigs kyis phan par bya ba'i dpyad ni /
analyzed: de'i dpyad bsgyur zhing bzlog thabs kyi bya bar sbyor cig / yang dmigs kyis phan par bya ba'i dpyad ni /
translated: Furthermore, the examination for specific benefit is as follows:

original: khrag rgyas pas nad du gyur pa la ni /
analyzed: khrag rgyas pas nad du gyur pa la ni /
translated: For a disease caused by excess blood,

original: gtar ga btab ste khrag dbyung ba dang bkru sman btang na phan no //
analyzed: gtar ga btab ste khrag dbyung ba dang bkru sman btang na phan no //
translated: Bloodletting and purgation are beneficial.

original: sha ha cang cher skyes pa las nad du gyur pa ni gtar ga dang thal sman rnon po dang / me btsa' btab na phan no //
analyzed: sha ha cang cher skyes pa las nad du gyur pa ni gtar ga dang thal sman rnon po dang / me btsa' btab na phan no //
translated: When flesh grows excessively and becomes a disease, bloodletting, strong purgatives, and cauterization are beneficial.

original: tshil ha cang ches te tshon por gyur pa lta bu la /
analyzed: tshil ha cang ches te tshon por gyur pa lta bu la /
translated: When fat becomes excessive and obese,

original: mi sbom po las skem por bya ba'i dpyad dang / rus pa zad nas rus pa phra mor gyur pa ni 'o ma btang ba dang / sman kha bo dang sbyar ba'i zhun mar dang / nyams brta ba'i sman mas btang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi sbom po las skem por bya ba'i dpyad dang / rus pa zad nas rus pa phra mor gyur pa ni 'o ma btang ba dang / sman kha bo dang sbyar ba'i zhun mar dang / nyams brta ba'i sman mas btang bar bya'o //
translated: the treatment is to make a stout person thin, and when bones become thin from exhaustion, one should give milk, clarified butter mixed with pungent medicine, and restorative medicine.

original: lto na bshang ba'i dri ma cher yod pa'i nad la ni rab tu 'khru bar bya ba'i dpyad do //
analyzed: lto na bshang ba'i dri ma cher yod pa'i nad la ni rab tu 'khru bar bya ba'i dpyad do //
translated: For a disease with excessive foul smell in the stomach, the treatment is strong purgation.

original: khong na bshang pa zad de med pa'i nad la ni /
analyzed: khong na bshang pa zad de med pa'i nad la ni /
translated: For a disease with exhaustion and absence of feces in the stomach,üîΩthe treatment is to give a decoction of pungent medicine.

original: ra 'am lug gi sha'i nang khrol las g-yos su bya ba dang / mon sran gre'u dang / til dang sbyar ba'i thug pa dang / rtsang phye dang / nas dang mon sran gre'u las g-yos su byas pa 'di lta bu byin na khong pa nang gi bshang ba skye zhing mang du 'gyur te phan no //

translated: If one gives food made from the entrails of sheep or goat, or porridge made with lentils, sesame, and barley flour, or food made with barley, lentils, and wheat, it will be beneficial because it will increase the feces in the intestines.

original: gcin mang ches na ni gcin 'bri zhing gso ba'i cho ga bya'o //üîΩgcin zad cing med na ni gcin snyi zhing @395a * //
analyzed: gcin mang ches na ni gcin 'bri zhing gso ba'i cho ga bya'o // gcin zad cing med na ni gcin snyi zhing @395a * //
translated: If there is excessive urination, one should reduce the urine and perform the ritual of healing.

original: mang ba'i dpyad bya'o //
analyzed: mang ba'i dpyad bya'o //
translated: If there is a deficiency or absence of urine, one should perform a procedure to make the urine thin and abundant.

original: rdul mi 'byung zhing zad pa'i nad la ni lus gsig cing bskyod de rdul dbyung bar bya ba dang / lus la mar gyis bsku ba dang / lus byibs shing dugs bya ba dang chang btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdul mi 'byung zhing zad pa'i nad la ni lus gsig cing bskyod de rdul dbyung bar bya ba dang / lus la mar gyis bsku ba dang / lus byibs shing dugs bya ba dang chang btung bar bya'o //
translated: If there is a disease of the depletion and absence of semen, one should massage the body, move it, and produce semen, anoint the body with ghee, wrap the body, apply heat, and drink alcohol.

original: yang lus kyi srog zungs bdun po kun la lus kyi me'i drod rang rang gi gnas na ran par 'dug pa de lta bu me'i drod snyoms pa ni /
analyzed: yang lus kyi srog zungs bdun po kun la lus kyi me'i drod rang rang gi gnas na ran par 'dug pa de lta bu me'i drod snyoms pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the seven bodily constituents are all well-nourished by the bodily heat, which is present in its own place in a balanced way.

original: lus kyi srog zungs la bde zhing brta ste phan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi srog zungs la bde zhing brta ste phan pa yin no //
translated: This balance of heat is beneficial and nourishing for the bodily constituents.

original: de las lus kyi me'i drod ha cang 'bar ches te che bar gyur na /
analyzed: de las lus kyi me'i drod ha cang 'bar ches te che bar gyur na /
translated: If the bodily heat becomes too intense and excessive,

original: lus kyi srog zungs thams cad tshig cing zad par byed de gnod do //
analyzed: lus kyi srog zungs thams cad tshig cing zad par byed de gnod do //
translated: it will burn up and exhaust all the bodily constituents, and thus be harmful.

original: de la dang por zas kyi bcud dangs ma rgyas shing rtag na /
analyzed: de la dang por zas kyi bcud dangs ma rgyas shing rtag na /
translated: If the nutritive essence of food first increases and is always present,

original: de bzhin srog zungs bdun po gcig nas gcig tu legs par brtas te bde ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin srog zungs bdun po gcig nas gcig tu legs par brtas te bde ba yin no //
translated: then the seven bodily constituents will be well-nourished one after another, and thus be happy.

original: de bzhin du dang por zas kyi bcud dangs ma nyams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang por zas kyi bcud dangs ma nyams te /
translated: Similarly, if the nutritive essence of food first declines and is harmed,

original: gnod par gyur na srog zungs bdun po gcig nas gcig tu gnod cing zad par byed do //
analyzed: gnod par gyur na srog zungs bdun po gcig nas gcig tu gnod cing zad par byed do //
translated: then the seven bodily constituents will be harmed and exhausted one after another.

original: de lta bas na zas kyi bcud dangs mar gyur te nyams pa des ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na zas kyi bcud dangs mar gyur te nyams pa des ni /
translated: Therefore, the nutritive essence of food, which has declined and is harmed,

original: rlung las mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad gang yang rung ste slong bar byed do //
analyzed: rlung las mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad gang yang rung ste slong bar byed do //
translated: It can also cause the arising of any disease of bile or phlegm.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nang g-yos pas srog zungs bdun po rnams la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nang g-yos pas srog zungs bdun po rnams la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the seven constituents are disturbed by wind, bile, and phlegm, they become sick.

original: srog zungs bdun po mi bde ba las bshang gci dri ma rnams gnyis la sogs pa la gnod pa'i nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog zungs bdun po mi bde ba las bshang gci dri ma rnams gnyis la sogs pa la gnod pa'i nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the seven constituents are sick, the two kinds of excrement and the impurities become sick and cause disease.

original: lus kyi dri ma'i gnod pa'i nang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi dri ma'i gnod pa'i nang du 'gyur ro //
translated: The impurities of the body become sick.

original: lus kyi dri ma'i nad kyang thur du 'byung ba'i dri ma rnam gnyis kyang mgo la /
analyzed: lus kyi dri ma'i nad kyang thur du 'byung ba'i dri ma rnam gnyis kyang mgo la /
translated: The impurities of the body are also of two kinds: those that come out and those that do not.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / mig dang / kha nas 'byung ba'i dri ma gtogs par bdun te 'di dgu dang lus las rdul 'byung ba rnams dri ma so so rang rang gi gnas nas 'byung ba de dag la nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / mig dang / kha nas 'byung ba'i dri ma gtogs par bdun te 'di dgu dang lus las rdul 'byung ba rnams dri ma so so rang rang gi gnas nas 'byung ba de dag la nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Excluding the impurities that come out of the head, ears, nose, eyes, and mouth, there are seven. These nine and the dust that arises from the body are the individual impurities that arise from their own places. They become sick.

original: de la srog zungs bdun po khu chu la sogs pa yan chad kyi nang na zas zos pa las nang na bcud dangs mar gyur pa de ni de la srog zungs bdun po rnams kyi nang na mchog yin no //
analyzed: de la srog zungs bdun po khu chu la sogs pa yan chad kyi nang na zas zos pa las nang na bcud dangs mar gyur pa de ni de la srog zungs bdun po rnams kyi nang na mchog yin no //
translated: Among the seven life-essences, semen, etc., that which is the finest essence of what is eaten, etc., is the best of the seven life-essences.

original: mdangs zhes bya ba snying gi nang na chu'i thigs pa ltar dangs shing gsal bar 'dug mod kyi lus la khyab ba dang / lus la brtan par gnas pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: mdangs zhes bya ba snying gi nang na chu'i thigs pa ltar dangs shing gsal bar 'dug mod kyi lus la khyab ba dang / lus la brtan par gnas pa ni de yin no //
translated: The so-called radiance is clear and bright like a drop of water in the heart, but it pervades the body and abides stably in the body.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mdangs zhes bya ba snying gi nang na yod pa'i thigs @395b pa de zhig ste nges par 'chi'o //
analyzed: mdangs zhes bya ba snying gi nang na yod pa'i thigs @395b pa de zhig ste nges par 'chi'o //
translated: The so-called radiance is a drop in the heart. If it is destroyed, one will certainly die.

original: mdangs de snying gi nang na ni mi yang mi 'chi ste /
analyzed: mdangs de snying gi nang na ni mi yang mi 'chi ste /
translated: If that radiance is in the heart, a person will not die.

original: mdangs kyi srog zungs brtan na sems can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi lus kyang gnas par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mdangs kyi srog zungs brtan na sems can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi lus kyang gnas par 'grub bo //
translated: If the life-essence of radiance is stable, the bodies of various sentient beings are also established as abiding.

original: mdangs de zad cing med par 'gyur ba ni sems bkres pa dang sems la mya ngan dang / dub cing ngal bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa las mdangs de zad cing med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdangs de zad cing med par 'gyur ba ni sems bkres pa dang sems la mya ngan dang / dub cing ngal bar 'gyur ba'i las byas pa las mdangs de zad cing med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The radiance diminishes and disappears due to the mind being hungry, sorrowful, and exhausted from work.

original: de lta bu'i mdangs de khong na med de zad par mngon pa'i rtags ni sngon pas snying chang ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mdangs de khong na med de zad par mngon pa'i rtags ni sngon pas snying chang ste /
translated: The signs of the radiance diminishing and disappearing are as follows:

original: cis kyang 'jigs shing sdang / lus rad /
analyzed: cis kyang 'jigs shing sdang / lus rad /
translated: One becomes afraid and hateful of anything, the body becomes thin,

original: sems zags te yang dang yang sems par byed /
analyzed: sems zags te yang dang yang sems par byed /
translated: and the mind becomes anxious and thinks again and again.

original: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po nyams /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po nyams /
translated: The sense faculties such as the eyes and ears deteriorate,üîΩand the complexion becomes pale and dull.

original: bzhin mdog nyams te bseng bseng po 'od 'od por 'dug / lus kyi khong rtsub cing khong snyom /
analyzed: bzhin mdog nyams te bseng bseng po 'od 'od por 'dug / lus kyi khong rtsub cing khong snyom /
translated: The body becomes rough and heavy,

original: rmya bag tu 'dug la /
analyzed: rmya bag tu 'dug la /
translated: and one becomes emaciated.

original: snying mi dga' na mdangs zad de med pa yin no //
analyzed: snying mi dga' na mdangs zad de med pa yin no //
translated: If the heart is unhappy, the radiance has diminished and disappeared.

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa la gso pa'i thabs ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa la gso pa'i thabs ni /
translated: The method of treatment for such a condition is as follows:

original: sman dang kha zas 'o ma dang bcud la sogs pa btang ngo //
analyzed: sman dang kha zas 'o ma dang bcud la sogs pa btang ngo //
translated: Medicines, nutritious food, milk, and essence should be given.

original: yang nad dmigs dang sbyar te zas byin pa las /
analyzed: yang nad dmigs dang sbyar te zas byin pa las /
translated: Furthermore, food should be given in accordance with the specific condition,

original: phan pa'i zas de mi 'dod cing kha zas mi 'phrod pa gzhan 'dod cing slong na /
analyzed: phan pa'i zas de mi 'dod cing kha zas mi 'phrod pa gzhan 'dod cing slong na /
translated: If they do not want that beneficial food and instead want and ask for other, incompatible food,üîΩthe doctor should not give them food that is incompatible with their illness. If there is no food that is incompatible with their illness, then give them what they want.

original: sman pas de la nad dang zas su mi 'phrod pa ni ma sbyin cig / nad la zas phan zhing mi 'phrod pa med na ni 'dod pa byin cig / yang na nad pa'o cog gi nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i zas lta bu yi gar 'ong zhing phyinüîΩci log tu byed pa yang yod /
analyzed: sman pas de la nad dang zas su mi 'phrod pa ni ma sbyin cig / nad la zas phan zhing mi 'phrod pa med na ni 'dod pa byin cig / yang na nad pa'o cog gi nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i zas lta bu yi gar 'ong zhing phyin ci log tu byed pa yang yod /
translated: Or, there are some who, like a patient, do what is pleasant and what is not in conflict with their illness and food.

original: la la ni nad la phan pa'i zas 'dod cing /
analyzed: la la ni nad la phan pa'i zas 'dod cing /
translated: There are some who want food that is beneficial for their illness

original: yi gar 'ong ba mthun pa yang yod de /üîΩde lta bu nad dang kha zas 'phrod dam mi 'phrod /
analyzed: yi gar 'ong ba mthun pa yang yod de / de lta bu nad dang kha zas 'phrod dam mi 'phrod /
translated: and what is pleasant and suitable.üîΩIn this way, give food that is compatible with the illness and food that is not compatible with the illness.

original: nad kyi tshul dang 'phrod dam mi 'phrod pa rtags la kha zas sbyin no //
analyzed: nad kyi tshul dang 'phrod dam mi 'phrod pa rtags la kha zas sbyin no //
translated: Give food that is compatible with the way the illness is.

original: yang na mi mkhas mi shis pa kun /
analyzed: yang na mi mkhas mi shis pa kun /
translated: Or, all that is unskilled and inauspicious

original: lus la phan zhing brta bar 'gyur ba dang / nad pas lus la gnod cing zad par byed pa'i dmigs mi rtog mi sems te /
analyzed: lus la phan zhing brta bar 'gyur ba dang / nad pas lus la gnod cing zad par byed pa'i dmigs mi rtog mi sems te /
translated: becomes beneficial and supportive for the body. The patient does not imagine or think about what is harmful and depleting for the body.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan lta bu'i so so'i nad dkyel skyes nas nad kyi mthur gyur na lus la nad kyis rgyas nas lus bde ba'i nyams 'tshag ni bri zhing zad /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan lta bu'i so so'i nad dkyel skyes nas nad kyi mthur gyur na lus la nad kyis rgyas nas lus bde ba'i nyams 'tshag ni bri zhing zad /
translated: When a specific illness arises, such as wind, bile, or phlegm, and becomes powerful, the body is filled with illness, and the experience of physical well-being diminishes and is exhausted.

original: nad kyi dkyel ni zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: nad kyi dkyel ni zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The power of the illness enters.

original: yang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nang du gyur pa yang med la /
analyzed: yang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nang du gyur pa yang med la /
translated: Moreover, there is no transformation into wind, bile, or phlegm.

original: 'di gsum nad 'phrod cing snyoms par gyur na /üîΩgsum po rang rang gi @396a * //
analyzed: 'di gsum nad 'phrod cing snyoms par gyur na / gsum po rang rang gi @396a * //
translated: When these three are balanced and in harmony,

original: las nyi tshe byed par zad de /
analyzed: las nyi tshe byed par zad de /
translated: each of the three acts only a little.

original: de bas na rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'phrod cing snyoms pa nad med cing lus la phan te bde ba dang / lus kyi nyams 'tshags brtas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'phrod cing snyoms pa nad med cing lus la phan te bde ba dang / lus kyi nyams 'tshags brtas par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when wind, bile, and phlegm are balanced and in harmony, there is no illness, the body is benefited, well-being and physical strength increase,

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum ma 'phrod cing ma snyoms pa'i nad dmigs te gsod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum ma 'phrod cing ma snyoms pa'i nad dmigs te gsod par byed pa yin no //
translated: and the illness of wind, bile, and phlegm not being balanced and in harmony is observed and eliminated.

original: de lta bas na lus la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na lus la phan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to benefit the body,

original: lus la nad kyi gnod pas zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / phan zhing bde ba lus rtag par 'gyur ba'i cho ga rim gro bya zhing lus bsrung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: lus la nad kyi gnod pas zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / phan zhing bde ba lus rtag par 'gyur ba'i cho ga rim gro bya zhing lus bsrung bar bya zhing /
translated: One should perform the rites and observances for the body to be healthy and happy and last a long time, and one should protect the body.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan nang mi 'phrod pa las lus la gnod cing zad par 'gyur pa'i nad dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan nang 'phrod cing snyoms na lus la bde zhing phan no //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan nang mi 'phrod pa las lus la gnod cing zad par 'gyur pa'i nad dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan nang 'phrod cing snyoms na lus la bde zhing phan no //
translated: If the humors of wind, bile, and phlegm are not in balance, the body is harmed and will be destroyed by illness, but if the wind, bile, and phlegm are in balance and harmonious, the body is happy and healthy.

original: nad med par 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nad med par 'gyur ba'i tshul bstan pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the eleventh chapter on the teaching of the way to be free from illness.

original: // / lus la bad kan dang mkhris pa dang rlung gang dang gang na gnas pa dang / rlung dang bad kan dang mkhris pa las sa'i nad dmigs cir 'gyur ba'i le'u bcu gnyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / lus la bad kan dang mkhris pa dang rlung gang dang gang na gnas pa dang / rlung dang bad kan dang mkhris pa las sa'i nad dmigs cir 'gyur ba'i le'u bcu gnyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, chapter twelve will explain where phlegm, bile, and wind are located in the body, and the illnesses that arise from wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum lus la ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gsum lus la ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: How are the three humors of wind, bile, and phlegm located in the body?

original: kha zas zhu ba'i gnas long ka dang / rgyu ma dang / rked pa dang / dpyi dang / brla dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi rus pa'o cog dang / lus kyi dbang po rig pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rlung gi gnas yin te /
analyzed: kha zas zhu ba'i gnas long ka dang / rgyu ma dang / rked pa dang / dpyi dang / brla dang / rna ba dang / lus kyi rus pa'o cog dang / lus kyi dbang po rig pa zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rlung gi gnas yin te /
translated: The locations of the wind are the stomach, the large intestine, the small intestine, the waist, the hips, the thighs, the ears, the bones of the body, and the faculty of touch of the body.

original: de rnams kyi nang na yang dmigs kyis rlung gi gnas ni zhu ba'i sa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na yang dmigs kyis rlung gi gnas ni zhu ba'i sa ste /
translated: Among them, the location of the wind is the place of digestion.

original: rgyu zhabs na rlung cher gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu zhabs na rlung cher gnas so //
translated: The wind is located in the lower belly.

original: mkhris pa ni zas ma zhu ba'i gnas zhes bya ba lte ba'i thad ka na yod pa pho ba dang rdul dang mthang gi chu ser dang / khrag dang zas kyi bcud dangs ma dang / mig dang lus kyi dbang po reg pa dang / 'di rnams kun la mkhris pa gnas so //
analyzed: mkhris pa ni zas ma zhu ba'i gnas zhes bya ba lte ba'i thad ka na yod pa pho ba dang rdul dang mthang gi chu ser dang / khrag dang zas kyi bcud dangs ma dang / mig dang lus kyi dbang po reg pa dang / 'di rnams kun la mkhris pa gnas so //
translated: The locations of bile are the stomach, the spleen, the liver, the gall bladder, the kidneys, the heart, the lungs, the eyes, the skin, the flesh, the blood, the lymph, the fat, the bones, the marrow, the semen, the menstrual blood, the channels, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails, and the faculty of touch of the body.

original: de rnams kyi nang na yang dmigs kyis lhag par mkhris pa ni lte ba'i thad ka na gnas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na yang dmigs kyis lhag par mkhris pa ni lte ba'i thad ka na gnas so //
translated: Among them, the location of bile is the stomach.

original: bad kan ni brang dang mgul pa dang / mgo bo dang / glo ba dang / rus pa'i tshigs kun dang / ma zhu ba'i gnas pho ba'i nang dang / zas kyi bcud dangs ma dang / tshil dang / snabs dang / lce dang @396b 'di rnams la bad kan gnas so //
analyzed: bad kan ni brang dang mgul pa dang / mgo bo dang / glo ba dang / rus pa'i tshigs kun dang / ma zhu ba'i gnas pho ba'i nang dang / zas kyi bcud dangs ma dang / tshil dang / snabs dang / lce dang @396b 'di rnams la bad kan gnas so //
translated: Phlegm is located in the chest, throat, head, lungs, all the joints of the bones, the stomach where undigested food is located, the essence of food, fat, mucus, and the tongue.

original: 'di rnams kyi nang na yang bad kan ni lhag par brang dang nam tshod na rtag par gnas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nang na yang bad kan ni lhag par brang dang nam tshod na rtag par gnas so //
translated: Among these, phlegm is especially located in the chest and throat.

original: yang de la rlung gi rang bzhin rnams pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang de la rlung gi rang bzhin rnams pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of wind:

original: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung dang / stod du rgyu ba'i rlung dang / khyab byed kyi rlung dang / me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung dang / thur du sel ba'i rlung dang lnga'o //
analyzed: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung dang / stod du rgyu ba'i rlung dang / khyab byed kyi rlung dang / me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung dang / thur du sel ba'i rlung dang lnga'o //
translated: the life-force wind, the upward-moving wind, the pervasive wind, the fire-accompanying wind, and the downward-voiding wind.

original: rlung 'di lnga la yang gnas dang / yul dang / las dang / rnam pa gsum gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rlung 'di lnga la yang gnas dang / yul dang / las dang / rnam pa gsum gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: Each of these five winds should be understood in terms of three aspects: location, domain, and function.

original: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung gi gnas ni spyi bo na 'dug go //
analyzed: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung gi gnas ni spyi bo na 'dug go //
translated: The life-force wind is located in the head.

original: rlung de'i yul ni brang dang nam tshong dang gre ba yan man rgyu zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: rlung de'i yul ni brang dang nam tshong dang gre ba yan man rgyu zhing 'gro'o //
translated: The domain of this wind is the chest, throat, and the upper and lower parts of the body.

original: las ni glo ba dang / snying dang / dbang po dang / sems rnams brtan pa dang / mchil ma 'dor ba dang / sbrid pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'bad cing sgrim par gtong ba dang / kha zas mid pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: las ni glo ba dang / snying dang / dbang po dang / sems rnams brtan pa dang / mchil ma 'dor ba dang / sbrid pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'bad cing sgrim par gtong ba dang / kha zas mid pa'i las byed do //
translated: Its functions are to support the lungs, heart, and sense organs, to produce saliva, to cause yawning, to cause exertion and effort, and to swallow food.

original: de la stod du rgyu ba'i rlung zhes bya ba'i gnas ni /
analyzed: de la stod du rgyu ba'i rlung zhes bya ba'i gnas ni /
translated: The so-called upward-moving wind is located

original: brang dang nam tshong na 'dug go de'i yul ni sna dang / lce dang / gre ba yan man du rgyu'o //
analyzed: brang dang nam tshong na 'dug go de'i yul ni sna dang / lce dang / gre ba yan man du rgyu'o //
translated: in the chest and throat. Its domain is the nose, tongue, and throat.

original: de'i las ni tshig tu smra ba 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'bad cing sgrim par byed pa dang / mdangs bzang ba dang / stobs yod pa dang / bzhin mdog dang ldan pa dang / dran par bya ba'i las byed do //
analyzed: de'i las ni tshig tu smra ba 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'bad cing sgrim par byed pa dang / mdangs bzang ba dang / stobs yod pa dang / bzhin mdog dang ldan pa dang / dran par bya ba'i las byed do //
translated: Its functions are to produce speech, to cause exertion and effort, to give good complexion, to give strength, to give a good face, and to cause memory.üîΩThe so-called pervasive wind is located

original: de la rlung khyab byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni snying la brten cing 'dug go //
analyzed: de la rlung khyab byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni snying la brten cing 'dug go //
translated: in the heart.

original: de'i yul ni lus thams cad la khyab par byed cing 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i yul ni lus thams cad la khyab par byed cing 'jug go //
translated: Its domain is to pervade and enter the entire body.

original: de'i las ni gang rab tu mgyogs pa dang / phan tshun 'gro bar byed pa dang / len cing 'degs pa dang / 'jog cing 'dor ba dang / mig 'byed pa dang / 'dzums pa la sogs pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: de'i las ni gang rab tu mgyogs pa dang / phan tshun 'gro bar byed pa dang / len cing 'degs pa dang / 'jog cing 'dor ba dang / mig 'byed pa dang / 'dzums pa la sogs pa'i las byed do //
translated: Its function is to move very quickly, to go back and forth, to take up and lift, to place and let go, to open and close the eyes, and so forth.

original: yang na lus kyi las su bya ba thams cad ni rlung 'di la phal cher rag lus so //
analyzed: yang na lus kyi las su bya ba thams cad ni rlung 'di la phal cher rag lus so //
translated: Or, all bodily actions are mostly dependent on this wind.

original: de la me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung gi gnas ni pho ba'i me'i drod dang lhan cig gnas so //
analyzed: de la me dang mnyam du gnas pa'i rlung gi gnas ni pho ba'i me'i drod dang lhan cig gnas so //
translated: The location of the wind that abides in harmony with fire is to abide together with the heat of the fire in the stomach.

original: de'i yul ni khong pa'i nang khrol thams cad kyi nang na 'gro zhing rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni khong pa'i nang khrol thams cad kyi nang na 'gro zhing rgyu'o //
translated: Its domain is to move and flow within all the inner organs of the abdomen.

original: las ni kha zas nang du len cing zhu bar byed /
analyzed: las ni kha zas nang du len cing zhu bar byed /
translated: Its function is to take up food and digest it.

original: dangs snyigs phye ste 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: dangs snyigs phye ste 'dor bar byed do //
translated: It separates the pure and impure parts and expels them.

original: de la thur du sel ba'i rlung gi gnas ni gzhang gi nang na 'dug go //
analyzed: de la thur du sel ba'i rlung gi gnas ni gzhang gi nang na 'dug go //
translated: The location of the downward-clearing wind is in the anus.

original: de'i yul ni 'dong mo'i nang la lgang ba dang / pho mtshan dang / brla'i nang phan tshun rgyu zhing 'gro'o @397a * //
analyzed: de'i yul ni 'dong mo'i nang la lgang ba dang / pho mtshan dang / brla'i nang phan tshun rgyu zhing 'gro'o @397a * //
translated: Its objects are the anus, the penis, the thighs, and so on, where it moves and goes.

original: las ni khu chu dang / zla mtshan 'byung ba dang / mngal nas byis pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / bshang gci thur du sel ba'i las byed do //
analyzed: las ni khu chu dang / zla mtshan 'byung ba dang / mngal nas byis pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / bshang gci thur du sel ba'i las byed do //
translated: Its functions are to produce semen, menstrual blood, and the child in the womb, and to eliminate feces and urine downward.

original: yang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Also, the nature of bile is fivefold:

original: 'ju byed dang / dmar sgyur dang / sgrub byed dang / mthong byed dang / mdog gsal dang 'di lnga'o //
analyzed: 'ju byed dang / dmar sgyur dang / sgrub byed dang / mthong byed dang / mdog gsal dang 'di lnga'o //
translated: digestion, transformation, formation, vision, and clarity of complexion.

original: 'di la mkhris pa 'ju byed ces bya ba ni gnas dang / gzhan gyi grogs byed cing yul rgyu ba dang / las byed pa dang rnam pa gsum du blta'o //
analyzed: 'di la mkhris pa 'ju byed ces bya ba ni gnas dang / gzhan gyi grogs byed cing yul rgyu ba dang / las byed pa dang rnam pa gsum du blta'o //
translated: Here, the so-called digestive bile should be viewed in three ways: its location, its assistance to others, its objects, and its functions.

original: de la yang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang ji lta zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: mkhris pa yang 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mkhris pa yang 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: Although bile is indeed the nature of the five great elements,

original: 'on kyang da ni me'i yon tan dang lhag par ldan la /
analyzed: 'on kyang da ni me'i yon tan dang lhag par ldan la /
translated: it is now endowed with the qualities of fire in excess.

original: gsher zhing sla ba lta bu'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gsher zhing sla ba lta bu'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of being moist and soft.

original: zas chos shing zhu bar byed pa'i las byed pas na /
analyzed: zas chos shing zhu bar byed pa'i las byed pas na /
translated: It performs the function of digesting food.

original: mkhris pa de ni me yin par bshad do //
analyzed: mkhris pa de ni me yin par bshad do //
translated: It is said that bile is fire.

original: mkhris pa de'i gnas ni zas zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug go //
analyzed: mkhris pa de'i gnas ni zas zhu ba gnyis kyi bar na 'dug go //
translated: The location of bile is between the two digestions of food.

original: de'i las ni kha zas tshas shing zhu bar byas te nyams mthu dang ldan par byed //
analyzed: de'i las ni kha zas tshas shing zhu bar byas te nyams mthu dang ldan par byed //
translated: Its function is to digest food, to make it strong and effective.

original: zas kyi snying khu'i bcud dang / tshigs ma bshad gci la sogs pa de dag so sor byed do //
analyzed: zas kyi snying khu'i bcud dang / tshigs ma bshad gci la sogs pa de dag so sor byed do //
translated: It makes the essence of the food, the urine, feces, etc.

original: mkhris pa de zhu ma zhu'i bar na 'dug nas /
analyzed: mkhris pa de zhu ma zhu'i bar na 'dug nas /
translated: Bile, located between digestion and non-digestion,

original: mkhris pa lhag ma gzhan dag gi grogs byed cing stod la /
analyzed: mkhris pa lhag ma gzhan dag gi grogs byed cing stod la /
translated: assists the other remaining bile and benefits the upper part.

original: phan 'dogs pa de ni yul rgyu zhing phan 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa de ni yul rgyu zhing phan 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: That which benefits by traveling through the country is beneficial.

original: dmar sgyur zhes bya ba'i gnas dang / las rnam pa gnyis su blta ste /
analyzed: dmar sgyur zhes bya ba'i gnas dang / las rnam pa gnyis su blta ste /
translated: The location and two types of function of that which is called ‚Äúthe transformer‚Äù should be seen.

original: gnas ni ma zhu ba'i san 'dug go //
analyzed: gnas ni ma zhu ba'i san 'dug go //
translated: The location is in the undigested food.

original: las ni zas kyi bcud dangs ma pho bar 'ong ba de mtshon dmar por sgyur ba bzhin dmar por 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: las ni zas kyi bcud dangs ma pho bar 'ong ba de mtshon dmar por sgyur ba bzhin dmar por 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: Its function is to transform the essence of food that comes into the stomach into a red color, like a red dye.

original: mkhris pa sgrub byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni snying la brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: mkhris pa sgrub byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni snying la brten cing gnas so //
translated: The site of the bile that produces is the heart.

original: de'i las ni sems dpa'i blo dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / snyoms pa'i nga rgyal du sems pa la sogs pas snying la bsams pa'i don mkhris pa de yod dam sgrub pa'i grogs don sgrub ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i las ni sems dpa'i blo dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / snyoms pa'i nga rgyal du sems pa la sogs pas snying la bsams pa'i don mkhris pa de yod dam sgrub pa'i grogs don sgrub ces bya'o //
translated: Its function is to assist the bile that exists in the heart or that produces the heart in the performance of its function, such as the mental activity of the mind, the sharpness of the mind, and the pride of equanimity.

original: mkhris pa mthong byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni mig la brten no //
analyzed: mkhris pa mthong byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni mig la brten no //
translated: The site of the bile that sees is the eyes.

original: de'i las ni gzugs rnams mthong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ni gzugs rnams mthong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Its function is to see forms.

original: mkhris pa mdog gsal byed ces bya ba'i gnas ni mi'i pags pa la brten te gnas so //

analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams bad kan des brtags te /

analyzed: dbang po tshim zhing mthu dang ldan par byed do //

What food is incompatible and has entered the primary humor, causing it to arise and increase? What is the procedure for food and medicine that heals and pacifies those three?

original: @398a * // rlung nad kyi dkyil du zhugs par bstsags pa de la kha zas bsil bgrang mo dang ma 'phrod nas rlung nad langs te na par byed do //
analyzed: @398a * // rlung nad kyi dkyil du zhugs par bstsags pa de la kha zas bsil bgrang mo dang ma 'phrod nas rlung nad langs te na par byed do //

analyzed: kha zas ro tsha ba la sogs pa bsil bag dang lhan cig zos pa ni /

analyzed: / de la ro legs par bro ba ma yin pa dang / mngar bag dang / kha ba dang / zas bsil bag tu sbyar bas ni mkhris pa'i nad de zhi bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sman skyur bag zos kyang rung ste de'i mkhris par stsogs ta /

analyzed: de'i tshe dgun gyi dus grang ba dang / kha zas snum po grang bag zos kyang rung //

analyzed: de ltar dus tshigs drug gi rang bzhin las rlung nad dang bad kan dang mkhris pa gsum gyi nad stsogs pa dang ldang ba rim par phye ste bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: rlung la sogs pa dkyil du gyur pa yang bsags @399a * //

analyzed: la ; nad ldang ba'i dus la bab tu zin kyang nad du mi 'gyur ba'i zas zos na nang mi ldang ngo //
translated: Even if the time for the arising of the disease has come, if one eats food that will not cause the disease, it will not arise.üîΩ As above, the wind, etc., having become concentrated,

analyzed: gong ma lta bur rlung la sogs pa nad dkyel du bsags pa de las nad langs te nad kyis btab pa ni /

analyzed: de bas na nad kyi tshul rnam pa sna tshogs grangs med pas /

translated: Moreover, it is not possible to demonstrate each of the many ways of illness. The methods of illness are subsumed in wind, bile, and phlegm.

analyzed: dper nyin thog thag bya nam mkha' la 'phur te 'gro ste /

analyzed: rang gi lus kyi grib ma dang 'bral du mi rung ba bzhin no //
